preqs: Students must have passed one of the following: AFG2631, AFW2631, BFB2631, AFC2140, BFB2140, BFC2140, BFF2140, BFP2140, BFW2140, BFF2631, AFF2631, BFG2631, BFP2631, AFP2631, BFW2631 or AFW3044 before undertaking this unit.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {1941, 2224, 3806, 4423, 4436, B2007}

Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {AFC2140, AFF2631, AFG2631, AFP2631, AFW2631, AFW3044, BFB2140, BFB2631, BFC2140, BFF2140, BFF2631, BFG2631, BFP2140, BFP2631, BFW2140, BFW2631} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Unit was previously coded {AFF3121, AFW3121, BFB3121}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFF3121, AFG3121, AFW3046, AFW3121, BFF3121, BFG3121, BFW3121}

description: On completion of this subject students should be able to demonstrate an understanding of the conceptual foundations of modern portfolio theory, using pricing models and other techniques in the valuation of securities; appreciate the effect of market efficiency on the valuation process; measure portfolio risk and determine performance benchmarks; and be able to take an applied perspective on investment management and analysis in the Australian environment.
